blurb: Linear equations can either have a single solution, infinite solutions, or no solutions. Learn how to determine the number of solutions to a given equation, and how to create equations with a desired number of solutions.

name: Linear equations word problems (Hindi) (Linear equations in one variable (Hindi))
blurb: Solve word problems by creating linear equations and solving them.

name: Two-step equation word problems (Hindi) (Linear equations in one variable (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to set up and solve equations to find answers to real-world questions.

name: Copy of Angles with polygons (Understanding quadrilaterals (Hindi))
blurb: Explore properties of angles in and arou polygons.

name: Quadrilateral types (Hindi) (Understanding quadrilaterals (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Quadrilateral proofs and angles (Hindi) (Understanding quadrilaterals (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Square roots (Hindi) (Square and square roots (Hindi))
blurb:
A strong contender for coolest symbol in mathematics is the radical.  What is it?  How does it relate to exponents?  How is the square root different than the cube root?  How can I simplify, multiply and add these things?  

This tutorial assumes you know the basics of exponents and exponent properties and takes you through the radical world for radicals (and gives you some good practice along the way)!

name: Approximating square roots (Hindi) (Square and square roots (Hindi))
blurb: Let's learn how to approximate square roots.

name: Simplifying square roots (Hindi) (Square and square roots (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Cube roots (Hindi) (Cube and cube roots (Hindi))
blurb: If you're familiar with the idea of a square root, we're about to take things one step (dimension?) further with the cube root.  This generally refers to finding a number that, when cubed, is equal to the number that you're trying to find the cube root of!

name: Adding & subtracting polynomials (Part1/2) (Hindi) (Algebraic expressions and identities (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to add and subtract polynomial expressions with one variable.

name: Adding and subtracting polynomials (Part2/2) (Hindi) (Algebraic expressions and identities (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to add and subtract two polynomials to obtain another polynomial. For instance, express (3x^3+2x-1)+(2x^4-x^3+7x) as a polynomial in standard form.

name: Copy of Multiplying monomials (Algebraic expressions and identities (Hindi))
blurb: As an intro to more elaborate polynomial multiplication, learn how to multiply monomials (which are polynomials with a single term). For example, multiply 2x³ and 5x⁷.

name: Copy of Multiplying monomials by polynomials (Algebraic expressions and identities (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to multiply a polynomial expression by a monomial expression. Monomials are just polynomials with a single term!

name: Multiplying binomials (Hindi) (Algebraic expressions and identities (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to multiply two binomials together. For example, (3x - 7) * (10x + 2).

name: Special products of binomials (Hindi) (Algebraic expressions and identities (Hindi))
blurb: Learn about the special types of products of binomials: perfect squares and the difference of two squares. These will be very helpful once you tackle more advanced expressions in Algebra.

name: Multiplying binomials by polynomials (Hindi) (Algebraic expressions and identities (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to multiply a polynomial expression by a binomial expression.

name: Polynomials word problems (Hindi) (Algebraic expressions and identities (Hindi))
blurb: See a few examples of how we can represent real-world situations with polynomials.

name: Area of trapezoids and composite figures (Hindi) (Mensuration (Hindi))
blurb: Finding the area of more complex shapes like trapezoids and composite figures (shapes built from other shapes)

name: Surface area (Hindi) (Mensuration (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Volume of rectangular prisms (Hindi) (Mensuration (Hindi))
blurb: Welcome to the 3rd dimension! [cue spooky music] This tutorial explains how to find volume.

name: Volume and surface area of cylinder (Hindi) (Mensuration (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Negative exponents (Hindi) (Exponents and powers (Hindi))
blurb:
It's normally a bad idea to hang around with negative people or do negative things, but we think it's OK to associate with negative exponents.  And fractional exponents are even more fun.

This idea will open up entirely new vistas to your mathematical life.

name: Direct and inverse proportion (Hindi) (Direct and inverse proportion (Hindi))
blurb: Learn about direct and inverse variation, which are two types of relationships between two quantities. Direct variation is simply a proportional relationship, but inverse variation is more complicated and interesting. Gain some experience with it before we dive deeper into the world of rational functions.

name: Introduction to factorization (Hindi) (Factorization (Hindi))
blurb: Learn what factorization is all about, and warm-up by factoring some monomials.

name: Factoring monomials (Hindi) (Factorization (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to write a monomial as a factor of two other monomials. For example, write 12x^3 as (4x)(3x^2).

name: Factoring polynomials by taking common factors (Hindi) (Factorization (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to take a common monomial factor out of a polynomial expression. For example, write 2x^3+6x^2+8x as (2x)(x^2+3x+4).

name: Evaluating expressions with unknown variables (Hindi) (Factorization (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to evaluate expressions with variables whose values are unknown, by using another information about those variables. For example, given that a+b=3, evaluate 4a+4b.

name: Factoring quadratics intro (Hindi) (Factorization (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to factor quadratic expressions with a leading coefficient of 1. For example, factor x²+3x+2 as (x+1)(x+2).

name: Factoring quadratics by grouping (Hindi) (Factorization (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to factor quadratic expressions with a leading coefficient other than 1. For example, factor 2x²+7x+3 as (2x+1)(x+3).

name: Factoring polynomials with quadratic forms (Hindi) (Factorization (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to factor quadratic polynomials of the form ax^2+bx+c as the product of two linear binomials. For example, write x^2+3x-10 as (x+5)(x-2). Learn how to identify these forms in more elaborate polynomials that aren't necessarily quadratic. For example, write x^4-4x^2-12 as (x^2+2)(x^2-6).

name: Factoring quadratics: Difference of squares (Hindi) (Factorization (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to factor quadratics that have the "difference of squares" form. For example, write x²-16 as (x+4)(x-4). Learn how to identify this form in more elaborate expressions. For example, write 4x²-49 as (2x+7)(2x-7).

name: Factoring quadratics: Perfect squares (Hindi) (Factorization (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to factor quadratics that have the "perfect square" form. For example, write x²+6x+9 as (x+3)². Learn how to identify these forms in more elaborate expressions. For example, write 4x²+28x+49 as (2x+7)².

name: Strategy in factoring quadratics (Hindi) (Factorization (Hindi))
blurb: There are a lot of methods to factor quadratics, which apply on different occasions and conditions. Now that we know all of them, let's think strategically about which of them is useful for a given quadratic expression we want to factor.

name: Factoring polynomials with special product forms (Hindi) (Factorization (Hindi))
blurb: Factor polynomials of various degrees using factorization methods that are based on the special product forms "difference of squares" and "perfect squares." For example, factor 25x⁴-30x²+9 as (5x²-3)².

name: Practice dividing polynomials with remainders (Hindi) (Factorization (Hindi))
blurb: After learning about the different methods in which we can find the quotient and the remainder of two polynomials, gain some practice with actually performing polynomial division yourself.

name: Intro to the coordinate plane (Hindi) (Introduction to graphs (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Coordinate plane word problems (Hindi) (Introduction to graphs (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Irrational numbers (Hindi) (Number systems (Hindi))
blurb: Learn what irrational numbers are. Also learn how to classify numbers as whole, integer, rational, and irrational.

name: Rational numbers and repeating decimals (Hindi) (Number systems (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to convert rational numbers from their repeating decimal form to their fractional form and vice versa.

name: Sums and products of rational and irrational numbers (Hindi) (Number systems (Hindi))
blurb: Determine whether various combinations of rational and irrational numbers are rational or irrational themselves.

name: Exponent properties review (Hindi) (Number systems (Hindi))
blurb: Practice using the exponent properties to rewrite powers, where the exponent is an integer that can either be positive or negative.

name: Radicals (Hindi) (Number systems (Hindi))
blurb: Radicals (also known as roots) are a generalization of square roots. They are the inverse operation of any power. For example, the 5th root of 32 is 2, because 2⁵=32.

name: Rational exponents intro (Hindi) (Number systems (Hindi))
blurb: Learn the definition for raising a number by a fractional exponent, like 8^⅔.

name: Properties of exponents (rational exponents) (Hindi) (Number systems (Hindi))
blurb: In this tutorial you will rewrite variable expressions with rational exponents using the properties of exponents.

name: Advanced: exponent & radical evaluation (Hindi) (Number systems (Hindi))
blurb: Let's evaluate elaborate expressions that contain radicals and fractional exponents.

name: Simplifying square roots (Hindi) (Number systems (Hindi))
blurb: We know how to evaluate square roots of perfect squares. For example, √16=4. What about the other square roots? It's harder to give an exact number, but we can simplify them so we have a better understanding of their value. For example, √32=4⋅√2. Learn more about it in this tutorial.

name: Simplifying radicals (higher-index roots) (Hindi) (Number systems (Hindi))
blurb: Just like we can simplify square roots, we can simplify other radicals. This tutorial covers the simplification of higher-index roots. For example, ∜48=2⋅∜3.

name: Radicals (miscellaneous videos) (Hindi) (Number systems (Hindi))
blurb: Various videos we have that cover advanced/special skills related to radical expressions.

name: Introduction to polynomials (Hindi) (Polynomials (Hindi))
blurb: What exactly is a polynomial? What does the degree of a polynomial mean? Are there many types of polynomials? Let's learn more about polynomials and some terms related to them.

name: Zeroes of a polynomial (Hindi) (Polynomials (Hindi))
blurb: What are zeroes of a polynomial? Why are they called the 'zeroes' when they are not the number zero? How do we find these zeroes?

name: Long division of polynomials (Hindi) (Polynomials (Hindi))
blurb: We can divide one number by another and get a quotient and a reminder. We use the long division method to do this for numbers. Polynomials are just numbers in variable form. Let's see how we can use the same long division method to divide one polynomial by another.

name: Polynomial Remainder Theorem (Hindi) (Polynomials (Hindi))
blurb: The polynomial remainder theorem allows us to easily determine whether a linear expression is a factor of a given polynomial. Learn exactly what the theorem means, practice using it, and learn about its proof.

name: Advanced polynomial factorization methods (Hindi) (Polynomials (Hindi))
blurb: Learn more ways to factor polynomials with degree higher than 2.

name: Intro to the coordinate plane (Hindi) (Coordinate geometry (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Coordinate plane: quadrant 1 (Hindi) (Coordinate geometry (Hindi))
blurb: How can we communicate exactly where something is in two dimensions?  In this tutorial, we cover the basics of the coordinate plane and graphing points.

name: Quadrants on the coordinate plane (Hindi) (Coordinate geometry (Hindi))
blurb: Learn the 4 quadrants of a coordinate plane.

name: Coordinate plane: 4 quadrants (Hindi) (Coordinate geometry (Hindi))
blurb: We first explored the coordinate plane in the 5th grade, but that was only dealing with positive coordinates.  Now we know all about negative numbers so why not have negative coordinates as well? Let's get cozy with the x and y axis, plotting ordered pairs, quadrants, and reflection points. We got it covered. Sit back, relax, and get ready to groove with us.  Common Core Standards: 6.NS.C.6, 6.NS.C.6b, 6.NS.C.6c, 6.NS.C.8

name: Coordinate plane word problems (Hindi) (Coordinate geometry (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Introduction to linear equation in 2 variables (Hindi) (Linear equations in two variables (Hindi))
blurb: Understand what a solution to an equation really means. Practice plugging in values for variables to see whether or not an equation is true. And then, learn about the ways to solving a two-variable linear equation.

name: Graph of a Linear Equation in Two Variables (Hindi) (Linear equations in two variables (Hindi))
blurb: Let's learn how to plot the graph of a linear equation in two variables and visualise why these equations are called 'linear'.

name: Linear models word problems (Hindi) (Linear equations in two variables (Hindi))
blurb: Solve general word problems about real-world relationships that can be modeled by linear equations or functions.

name: Geometric definitions (Hindi) (Lines and angles (Hindi))
blurb: Consider how precise definitions of geometry terms are like angle, circle, parallel lines, and a few others.

name: Angle types (Hindi) (Lines and angles (Hindi))
blurb: Now that we know what angles are, let's dig a bit deeper and classify them and understand their properties better. Acute, obtuse, right, adjacent--all are angles that we will be become familiar with.

name: Vertical, complementary, and supplementary angles (Hindi) (Lines and angles (Hindi))
blurb: Learn three types of angle pairs: vertical angles, complementary angles, and supplementary angles.

name: Angles between intersecting lines (Hindi) (Lines and angles (Hindi))
blurb: This tutorial introduces us to angles.  It includes how we measure them, how angles relate to each other and properties of angles created from various types of intersecting lines.  Mr. Angle is actually far more fun than you might initially presume him to be.

name: Triangle angles (Hindi) (Lines and angles (Hindi))
blurb:
Do the angles in a triangle always add up to the same thing?  Would I ask it if they didn't?  What do we know about the angles of a triangle if two of the sides are congruent (an isosceles triangle) or all three are congruent (an equilateral)?  This tutorial is the place to find out.

Common Core Standard: 8.G.A.5

name: Congruence of Triangles & its criteria (Hindi) (Triangles (Hindi))
blurb: How do we know that two triangles are congruent if we cannot check by physically placing them on top of each other? We can use the various postulates of congruence- SSS, SAS, ASA and RHS to identify congruent triangles. We'll study these in detail and see a few examples of congruence here.

name: Proofs of theorems that use triangle congruence (Hindi) (Triangles (Hindi))
blurb: Gain even more experience with using triangle congruence in proofs.

name: Theorems concerning triangle properties (Hindi) (Triangles (Hindi))
blurb: Now that we know how to show that two triangles are congruent, let's put that to use by proving some theorems about triangles.

name: Inequalities in a Triangle (Hindi) (Triangles (Hindi))
blurb: In this section, we will study Triangle Inequality Theorem which shows the relation between angles of a triangle and length of sides.

name: Quadrilaterals (Hindi) (Quadrilaterals (Hindi))
blurb: Not all things with four sides and 90 degree angles are squares or rectangles! Sometimes the angles in these 4-sided shapes are less than (or greater than) 90 degrees, causing them to have a slightly odd shape. These are called quadrilaterals and come in a few different varieties. In this tutorial, you'll learn about them.  Common Core Standards: 5.G.B.3, 5.G.B.4

name: Copy of Quadrilateral proofs and angles (Hindi) (Quadrilaterals (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Area of parallelogram (Hindi) (Areas of parallelograms and triangles (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Area of a triangle (Hindi) (Areas of parallelograms and triangles (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Circles basics (Hindi) (Circles (Hindi))
blurb: Make sure you're familiar with notation and key terms like radius, diameter, circumference, pi, tangent, secant, and major/minor arcs before you dive into the rest of the circles content.

name: Chord and Circles (Hindi) (Circles (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Points and Circles (Hindi) (Circles (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Inscribed angles (Hindi) (Circles (Hindi))
blurb: We'll now dig a bit deeper in our understanding of circles by looking at inscribed angles and related properties.

name: Inscribed shapes problem solving (Hindi) (Circles (Hindi))
blurb: Use properties of inscribed angles to prove properties of inscribed shapes, then apply these properties to some fun problem solving!

name: Area of a triangle-by Heron's formula (Hindi) (Heron's Formula (Hindi))
blurb: Till now we have read 1/2*b*h as the only formulae to calculate the area of a triangle, now we will be able to calculate the area of any triangle using heron's Formula.

name: Surface area (Hindi) (Surface areas and volumes (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Volume of cubes and cuboids (Hindi) (Surface areas and volumes (Hindi))
blurb: Welcome to the 3rd dimension! [cue spooky music] This tutorial explains how to find volume.

name: Volume of cones, cylinders, and spheres (Hindi) (Surface areas and volumes (Hindi))
blurb: Let's see how to find the volumes of cylinders, spheres and other three dimensional shapes.

name: Measures of Central Tendency (Hindi) (Statistics (Hindi))
blurb: Now we will learn to analyse the data and put it into practical use. We will learn the meaning and how to calculate Mean (frequency included), median and mode of a given data.

name: Probability basics (Hindi) (Probability (Hindi))
blurb: Flip a quarter a hundred times. What's the probability that it will turn up heads? Tails? Even if we are unsure about whether something will happen, we can start to be mathematical about the "chances" of an event (essentially realizing that some things are more likely than others) occurring. This tutorial will introduce us to the tools that allow us to think about random events and the logic behind comparing, judging, and finding the probabilities of those events.

name: The Fundamental Theorem of Arithmetic (Hindi) (Real numbers (Hindi))
blurb: We will be learning how can we  express every composite number (factorised) as a product of primes, and no matter what this factorisation is always unique, apart from the order in which the prime factors occur. With the knowledge of  the fundamental theorem of arithmetic, we'll revisit the basic concepts like finding LCM and HCF of numbers in a much more efficient manner.

name: HCF and LCM (Hindi) (Real numbers (Hindi))
blurb: You know how to find factors of a number.  But what about factors that are common to two numbers?  Even better, imagine the largest factors that are common to two numbers.   I know.  Too exciting!

name: Proofs related to irrational numbers (Hindi) (Real numbers (Hindi))
blurb: In this section, we will prove that square root of a general prime number 'p' is irrational. We will also take an example to see how this works.

name: Converting fractions to repeating decimals (Hindi) (Real numbers (Hindi))
blurb: In class 9 we've already studied about the decimal expansion of rational numbers. This time we'll be moving to learn and explore exactly when the decimal expansion of p/q is terminating and when it is non-terminating repeating (or recurring) by considering a rational number, say p/q where q is not equal to 0 􀀀

name: Intro to polynomials (Hindi) (Polynomials (Hindi))
blurb: Learn about polynomial expressions: What are they? How are they constructed? What can we do with them?

name: Finding zeros of polynomials  (Hindi) (Polynomials (Hindi))
blurb: Use all the knowledge you have about polynomials to find their zeros (which are the input values that make the polynomial equal to zero).

name: Zeros of polynomials and their graphs (Hindi) (Polynomials (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to use the zeros of polynomials to draw a pretty good sketch of their graphs.

name: Long division of polynomials  (Hindi) (Polynomials (Hindi))
blurb:
Now we will be learning the division algorithm for the polynomials. We will first arrange the terms of the dividend and the divisor in the decreasing order
of their degrees. Now the division algorithm would be stated as p(x) and g(x) are any two polynomials with g(x) ≠ 0, then we can find polynomials q(x) and r(x) such that p(x) = g(x) × q(x) + r(x), where r(x) = 0 or degree of r(x) < degree of g(x).

name: Relationship between coefficients and zeroes of a polynomial (Hindi) (Polynomials (Hindi))
blurb: **Rough** Find the polynomial given the two roots and vice versa. Use -b/a and c/a.

name: Modelling real-world scenarios with linear equations (Hindi) (Pair of linear equations in two variables (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to represent real-world relationships (that are described verbally) with linear graphs, equations, or functions.

name: Copy of Linear models word problems (Pair of linear equations in two variables (Hindi))
blurb: Solve general word problems about real-world relationships that can be modeled by linear equations or functions.

name: Slope (Hindi) (Pair of linear equations in two variables (Hindi))
blurb: Learn about slope (the steepness of a line) and how to find it.

name: Solving equations using the elimination method (Hindi) (Pair of linear equations in two variables (Hindi))
blurb: Learn about the elimination method, which is a way manipulate systems of equations in order to solve them algebraically. This is actually very similar to the way we manipulate single equations in order to solve them!

name: Solving systems of equations with substitution (Hindi) (Pair of linear equations in two variables (Hindi))
blurb: Learn about the substitution method, which is another way to manipulate systems of equations in order to solve them.

name: Number of solutions to systems of equations (Hindi) (Pair of linear equations in two variables (Hindi))
blurb: Learn about the possible number of solutions of systems of linear equations. Spoiler: There can be a single solution, zero solutions, or infinite solutions. These different cases define the distinctions between "consistent" and "inconsistent" systems, and between "dependent" and "independent" systems.

name: Systems of equations word problems (Hindi) (Pair of linear equations in two variables (Hindi))
blurb: Now that we are able to solve any kind of system we are given, it's time to use that knowledge to solve some word problems.

name: Solving equations reducible to linear form (Hindi) (Pair of linear equations in two variables (Hindi))
blurb: **Rough** Questions reducible to linear form. One video that shows problems being converted to linear form. (Without solving. Perhaps solve one.)  One more video with upstream downstream question (Word problem).

name: Quadratic factored form (Hindi) (Quadratic equations (Hindi))
blurb: The factored form of a quadratic function is an expression that is, well, factored! Like f(x)=(2x+1)(x-3). Learn how to analyze functions given in this form to find their zeros, their vertex, and their graph.

name: Solving quadratics by taking square roots (Hindi) (Quadratic equations (Hindi))
blurb: In this tutorial you will learn about the most basic way of solving quadratic equations.

name: Solving quadratics by factoring (Hindi) (Quadratic equations (Hindi))
blurb: In this tutorial, you'll learn some pretty elaborate ways of solving quadratic equations, by harnessing the mighty strength of algebra.

name: Solving quadratics by completing the square (Hindi) (Quadratic equations (Hindi))
blurb: Factorisation is just one way to find the root of the quadratic equation, in this section we will study about two more methods - completing the squares and Use of quadratic formula. So now, when you are given a quadratic equation you can see which methods to use to factorise it.

name: Solving quadratics using the quadratic formula (Hindi) (Quadratic equations (Hindi))
blurb: Now that we know how to solve quadratics using factorisation and completing the perfect square, let's move on to discuss yet another way to find the factors. We call this the quadratic formula.

name: Word problems on quadratic equations (Hindi) (Quadratic equations (Hindi))
blurb: **Rough** An intro video about modelling real-world scenarios.. a couple of exercises... A couple of solved examples.

name: Solving quadratic equations (Hindi) (Quadratic equations (Advanced) (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Nature of roots (Hindi) (Quadratic equations (Advanced) (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Intro to arithmetic progressions (Hindi) (Arithmetic progressions (Hindi))
blurb: Learn about arithmetic sequences and their main features, the initial term and the common difference. Evaluate arithmetic sequences.

name: Constructing arithmetic sequences (Hindi) (Arithmetic progressions (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to find the explicit formula of an arithmetic sequence.

name: Sigma notation (Hindi) (Arithmetic progressions (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to use and interpret sigma notation. Hint: It means take the sum!

name: Sum to n terms of an arithmetic progression (Hindi) (Arithmetic progressions (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to evaluate and work with finite arithmetic series.

name: Definitions of similarity (Hindi) (Triangles (Hindi))
blurb: In this tutorial, you will learn how we determine whether two figures are similar.

name: Introduction to triangle similarity (Hindi) (Triangles (Hindi))
blurb: In this tutorial, we will use what we learned about similarity of polygons in the specific case of triangles. We will come up with specific conditions for triangles to be similar, and use them to determine whether two triangles are similar.

name: Solving similar triangles (Hindi) (Triangles (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to find missing measures of triangles using the fact that they are similar to other triangles.

name: Solving problems with similar and congruent triangles (Hindi) (Triangles (Hindi))
blurb: You already saw how we can use similarity and congruence to find missing measures in triangles. Let's do the same now to solve more kinds of polygons, and more challenging problems!

name: Solving modeling problems with similar and congruent triangles (Hindi) (Triangles (Hindi))
blurb: Now that you are an expert with solving geometry problems using congruence and similarity, you are ready to solve some real-world problems!

name: Copy of Distance formula (Coordinate geometry (Hindi))
blurb: Let's learn how to find the distance between two points using Pythagoras theorem. This result is called the "distance formula".

name: Dividing Line segments: section formula (Hindi) (Coordinate geometry (Hindi))
blurb: Let's learn to find to find the coordinates of a point that divides a line segment in a given ratio.  We do this using similarity of triangles. The result we get is famously called the "section formula'.

name: Midpoint formula (Hindi) (Coordinate geometry (Hindi))
blurb: Find the distance between two points or the midpoint of two points.

name: Problem solving with distance on the coordinate plane (Hindi) (Coordinate geometry (Hindi))
blurb: Use what you know about distance to solve problems on the coordinate plan like finding the perimeter of a shape or determining if a point is on a circle.

name: Introduction to Trigonometric ratios (Hindi) (Introduction to trigonometry (Hindi))
blurb: As it is the first time we are studying trigonometry, we will first understand the few introductory terms of sin,cos,tan,cosec,sec,cot,etc and will also learn few values of the trigonometric ratios. The values of an angle do not vary with the lengths of the sides of the triangle, if the angle remains the same. We will also be practicing few questions on the values of trigonometric ratios.

name: Solving for a side in a right triangle using the trigonometric ratios (Hindi) (Introduction to trigonometry (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to find a side length in a right triangle when given one side length and one acute angle.

name: The reciprocal trigonometric ratios (Hindi) (Introduction to trigonometry (Hindi))
blurb: Learn about the remaining three side ratios in a right triangle: the secant, the cosecant, and the cotangent.

name: Trigonometric ratios and similarity (Hindi) (Introduction to trigonometry (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how the trigonometric ratios are derived from triangle similarity considerations.

name: Sine and cosine of complementary angles (Hindi) (Introduction to trigonometry (Hindi))
blurb: Learn about the relationship between the sine of an angle and the cosine of its complementary angle, which is the angle that completes to 90°.

name: Trigonometric ratios of special triangles (Hindi) (Introduction to trigonometry (Hindi))
blurb: Learn to find the sine, cosine, and tangent of 45-45-90 triangles and also 30-60-90 triangles.

name: Trigonometric Identities (Hindi) (Introduction to trigonometry (Hindi))
blurb: After learning the values of trigonometric ratios we will find the relationship between them to establish trigonometric identities.

name: Heights and distances (Hindi) (Some applications of trigonometry (Hindi))
blurb: Solve real-world problems that can be modeled by right triangles, using trigonometry.

name: Tangent to a Circle (Hindi) (Circles (Hindi))
blurb: Tangents are a very interesting and useful concept in Geometry. Their properties are used in solving several geometry problems and we will try to do some here.

name: Copy of Circles basics (Area Related to Circles (Hindi))
blurb: Make sure you're familiar with notation and key terms like radius, diameter, circumference, pi, tangent, secant, and major/minor arcs before you dive into the rest of the circles content.

name: Arc measure (Hindi) (Area Related to Circles (Hindi))
blurb: Arc measure is equal to the arc's central angle. We'll explore this fact and solve some problems related to it.

name: Arc length (degrees) (Hindi) (Area Related to Circles (Hindi))
blurb: Think about the relationship between central angle and arc length. This tutorial uses degrees not radians.

name: Introduction to radians (Hindi) (Area Related to Circles (Hindi))
blurb: Most people know that you can measure angles with degrees, but only exceptionally worldly people know that radians can be an exciting alternative. As you'll see, degrees are somewhat arbitrary.

name: Arc length (radians) (Hindi) (Area Related to Circles (Hindi))
blurb: Think about the relationships between arc measures, central angles, and arc length in radians.

name: Sectors (Hindi) (Area Related to Circles (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to find the area of a sector.

name: Area of a segment (Hindi) (Area Related to Circles (Hindi))
blurb: **Rough** Start with a question - Make radius 42 and angle 60 degree (Ask Ashish for example)

name: Area of combination of figures (Hindi) (Area Related to Circles (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Volume and surface area word problems (Hindi) (Surface Areas and Volumes (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Volume and surface area of a frustum of a cone (Hindi) (Surface Areas and Volumes (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Mean of grouped data (Hindi) (Statistics (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Median of grouped data (Hindi) (Statistics (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Mode of grouped data (Hindi) (Statistics (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Plotting ogives (Hindi) (Statistics (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Probability basics (Hindi) (Probability (Hindi))
blurb: Flip a quarter a hundred times. What's the probability that it will turn up heads? Tails? Even if we are unsure about whether something will happen, we can start to be mathematical about the "chances" of an event (essentially realizing that some things are more likely than others) occurring. This tutorial will introduce us to the tools that allow us to think about random events and the logic behind comparing, judging, and finding the probabilities of those events.

name: Intersection and union of sets (Hindi) (Sets (Hindi))
blurb: Learn about the intersection and union of sets using venn diagrams.

name: Types of sets (Hindi) (Sets (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Operations on sets (Hindi) (Sets (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Evaluating functions (Hindi) (Relations and functions (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to find the value of a function for a given input value.

name: Inputs and outputs of a function (Hindi) (Relations and functions (Hindi))
blurb: Extend your understanding of the relationship between the inputs of a function and the outputs of that function.

name: Interpreting function notation (Hindi) (Relations and functions (Hindi))
blurb: Solve some word problems by interpreting expressions of modeling functions.

name: Functions and equations (Hindi) (Relations and functions (Hindi))
blurb: Understand the subtle differences and similarities between functions and equations. In this exercise, we will see how an equation can be turned into a function.

name: Introduction to the domain and range of a function (Hindi) (Relations and functions (Hindi))
blurb: Learn what the domain and the range of a function are. Practice finding the domain and the range of a function given its graph.

name: Determining the domain of a function (Hindi) (Relations and functions (Hindi))
blurb: Determine the domains of functions according to various considerations.

name: Recognizing functions (Hindi) (Relations and functions (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to distinguish between two-variable relationships that are functions and two-variable relationships that aren't functions.

name: Maximum and minimum points (Hindi) (Relations and functions (Hindi))
blurb: Learn about maximum and minimum points of functions.

name: Intervals where a function is positive, negative, increasing, or decreasing (Hindi) (Relations and functions (Hindi))
blurb: Learn about features of functions that have distinct graphical representations: intervals where the function is always positive or always negative, and intervals where the function is always increasing or always decreasing.

name: Interpreting features of graphs (Hindi) (Relations and functions (Hindi))
blurb: Interpret the graphs of functions in terms of the contexts that are modeled by the functions.

name: Combining functions (Hindi) (Relations and functions (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Piecewise functions (Hindi) (Relations and functions (Hindi))
blurb: We are used to functions that have the same rule for all inputs. For example, f(x)=x² outputs the square of every input. Piecewise functions have different output rules, depending on the inputs. For example, we can define function g to output x² for all positive values of x and x³ for all negative values of x, so g(2)=4 and g(-2)=-8.

name: Determining the domain of advanced functions (Hindi) (Relations and functions (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to determine the domain of piecewise functions with different function rules.

name: Determining the range of advanced functions (Hindi) (Relations and functions (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to find the range of a function, which is the set of all of the function's possible outputs.

name: Introduction to logarithms (Hindi) (Exponential and Logarithmic functions (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how we define logarithms and use this definition in order to evaluate various logarithms. For example, evaluate log_2(8) as 3 by realizing that 2^3=8.

name: The constant e and the natural logarithm (Hindi) (Exponential and Logarithmic functions (Hindi))
blurb: Learn about a very special constant in math that has a pivotal role in the world of exponential and logarithmic function, the constant e.

name: Properties of logarithms (Hindi) (Exponential and Logarithmic functions (Hindi))
blurb: Learn about special properties of logarithms that help us rewrite logarithmic expressions in different equivalent (much like we use properties of exponents to rewrite exponential expressions!).

name: Change of base formula for logarithms (Hindi) (Exponential and Logarithmic functions (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to rewrite any logarithmic expression in a different base. For example, rewrite log_2(3) as ln(3)/ln(2). This is very helpful for evaluating logarithms with a calculator, which only evaluates base-10 and base-e logarithms.

name: Exponential equations: logarithms (Hindi) (Exponential and Logarithmic functions (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to solve any exponential equation by using logarithms. For example, solve 2^x=3 by calculating log_2(3).

name: Solving exponential models (Hindi) (Exponential and Logarithmic functions (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to solve word problems that require exponential equations.

name: Intro to radians (Hindi) (Trigonometric functions (Hindi))
blurb: Angle is a measure of the rotation about a point. We will explore different aspects of an angle and will understand what are degrees and radians.

name: Trigonometric values of special angles (Hindi) (Trigonometric functions (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to find the trigonometric values of some special angles without the use of a calculator.

name: Trigonometric functions (Hindi) (Trigonometric functions (Hindi))
blurb: Learn about the ingenious way in which we define the trigonometric functions for any real number.

name: The graphs of sine, cosine, and tangent (Hindi) (Trigonometric functions (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how the graphs of y=sin(θ), y=cos(θ), and y=tan(θ) look, using the unit circle definition of the functions.

name: Trigonometric identities (Hindi) (Trigonometric functions (Hindi))
blurb: (No description)

name: Trigonometric equations (Hindi) (Trigonometric functions (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to solve equations of the form sin(x)=d or cos(x)=d where d is any number. For example, solve sin(x)=0.6.

name: What are the imaginary numbers? (Hindi) (Complex numbers (Hindi))
blurb: Learn about the imaginary unit i (which is the square root of -1) and about imaginary numbers like 3i (which is the square root of -9).

name: What are the complex numbers? (Hindi) (Complex numbers (Hindi))
blurb: Learn about complex numbers (spoiler: they are numbers that consist of both real and imaginary parts).

name: The complex plane (Hindi) (Complex numbers (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how we can visualize complex numbers in a plane. This can be seen as an expansion of the 1-dimensional real number line into a 2-dimensional plane!

name: Adding & subtracting complex numbers (Hindi) (Complex numbers (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to add or subtract complex numbers. For example, write (2+3i)-(1+2i) as (1+i).

name: Multiplying complex numbers (Hindi) (Complex numbers (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to multiply complex numbers using the fact that i^2=-1 and the distributive property. For example, multiply (1+i) by (2+3i).

name: Complex conjugates & dividing complex numbers (Hindi) (Complex numbers (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to divide complex numbers using the conjugate of the divisor. For example, divide (2+3i) by (-1+4i) by multiplying both the dividend and the divisor by (-1-4i).

name: Absolute value & angle of complex numbers (Hindi) (Complex numbers (Hindi))
blurb: Learn about very important graphical features of complex numbers: their absolute value and their angle.

name: Distance & midpoint of complex numbers (Hindi) (Complex numbers (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how we define the distance of two complex numbers, and how we define their midpoint.

name: Polar form of complex numbers (Hindi) (Complex numbers (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to represent complex numbers in a different way. Unlike rectangular form, which emphasizes the real and imaginary parts, polar form emphasizes the absolute value ("modulus") and the angle ("argument").

name: Multiplying & dividing complex numbers in polar form (Hindi) (Complex numbers (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how complex multiplication and division work when the numbers are given in polar form. Amazingly enough, this is much easier than multiplication and division in rectangular form.

name: Introduction to inequalities with variables (Hindi) (Linear inequalities (Hindi))
blurb: Algebraic inequalities (inequalities with variables) are useful for describing real-world situations. Learn how to write inequalities and graph them on the number line.

name: One-step inequalities (Hindi) (Linear inequalities (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to solve (mathematical) inequalities. A key concept in this tutorial is flipping the inequality sign when multiplying or dividing both sides by a negative number.

name: Two-step inequalities (Hindi) (Linear inequalities (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to solve more complex (mathematical) inequalities. Also learn to construct inequalities to model real-world situations.

name: Multi-step inequalities (Hindi) (Linear inequalities (Hindi))
blurb: Solve any possible linear inequality in one variable. For example, solve -3x-7<x+9.

name: Compound inequalities (Hindi) (Linear inequalities (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to solve compound inequalities. For example, solve 2x+1>3 AND -x-5<4.

name: Checking solutions of two-variable inequalities (Hindi) (Linear inequalities (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to check possible solutions of two-variable linear inequalities. For example, is (2, 0) a solution to y>x+1? In this tutorial, we also check solutions to systems of inequalities.

name: Constraining solutions of two-variable inequalities (Hindi) (Linear inequalities (Hindi))
blurb: Given a specific value for one of the variables in a two-variable linear inequality (or system of inequalities), learn how to find the corresponding range of values for the other variable. For example, given that x=3, what are the possible values for y in 2x+y<1 ?

name: Graphing two-variable inequalities (Hindi) (Linear inequalities (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to graph two-variables linear inequalities and systems of two-variable linear inequalities.

name: x-intercepts and y-intercepts (Hindi) (Straight lines (Hindi))
blurb: Learn about intercepts and practice finding them from graphs, tables, and equations.

name: Slope (Hindi) (Straight lines (Hindi))
blurb: Learn about slope (the steepness of a line) and how to find it.

name: Horizontal & vertical lines (Hindi) (Straight lines (Hindi))
blurb: You know what horizontal and vertical lines are, but how do their equations look? And what is their slope? Learn all about it in this tutorial.

name: Intro to slope-intercept form (Hindi) (Straight lines (Hindi))
blurb: Make an introduction with the most common form of linear equations, slope-intercept form! For example, y=3x+5 is a linear equation in slope-intercept form.

name: Graphing slope-intercept equations (Hindi) (Straight lines (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to graph linear equations that are given in slope-intercept form. For example, graph y=2x+3.

name: Parallel and perpendicular lines on the coordinate plane (Hindi) (Straight lines (Hindi))
blurb: You probably know what parallel and perpendicular lines are. In this tutorial, you will learn how these relationships are expressed on the coordinate plane (spoiler: parallel lines have the same slope, and the product of the slopes of perpendicular lines is always -1).

name: Equations of parallel and perpendicular lines (Hindi) (Straight lines (Hindi))
blurb: Learn all about equations of parallel and perpendicular

name: Writing slope-intercept equations (Hindi) (Straight lines (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how to write the equation of a line (in slope-intercept form) when given the graph of the equation or two points on the line. For example, write the equation of the line that passes through the points (0,1) and (5,4).

name: Limits introduction (Hindi) (Limits (Hindi) )
blurb: A limit is the value that a function or sequence "approaches" as the input or index approaches some value. In this tutorial, we supply an intuitive understanding of limits.

name: Limits from tables (Hindi) (Limits (Hindi) )
blurb: Find limits by creating a table of values and analyzing the trend.

name: Limits from graphs (Hindi) (Limits (Hindi) )
blurb: Find limits by analyzing graphs.

name: One-sided limits (Hindi) (Limits (Hindi) )
blurb: Learn what one-sided limits are and analyze them via graphs.

name: One-sided vs. Two-sided limits (Hindi) (Limits (Hindi) )
blurb: Investigate the relationship between a two-sided limit at a point and the one-sided limits at that point (spoiler: the two-sided limits exists if and only if the one-sided limits exist and are equal).

name: Review: Limits basics (Hindi) (Limits (Hindi) )
blurb: Review your understanding of the basics of limits with some challenge problems.

name: Limits from equations (direct substitution) (Hindi) (Limits (Hindi) )
blurb: Take your first steps in finding limits algebraically. For example, find the limit of x²+5x at x=2, or determine whether the limit of 2x/(x+1) at x=-1 exists.

name: Limits from equations (factoring & rationalizing) (Hindi) (Limits (Hindi) )
blurb: There are some limits that want us to work a little before we find them. Learn about two main methods of dealing with such limits: factorization and rationalization. For example, find the limit of (x²-1)/(x-1) at x=1.

name: Squeeze theorem (Hindi) (Limits (Hindi) )
blurb: The Squeeze theorem (or Sandwich theorem) states that for any three functions f, g, and h, if f(x)≤g(x)≤h(x) for all x-values on an interval except for a single value x=a, and the limits of f and h at x=a are equal to L, then the limit of g at x=a must be equal to L as well. This may seem simple but it's pure genius. Learn how it helps us find tricky limits like sin(x)/x at x=0.

name: Limits of trigonometric functions (Hindi) (Limits (Hindi) )
blurb: Find limits of trigonometric functions by manipulating the functions (using trigonometric identities) into expressions that are nicer to handle. For example, find the limit of sin(x)/sin(2x) at x=0.

name: Limits of piecewise functions (Hindi) (Limits (Hindi) )
blurb: Remember one-sided limits? Well, these are very useful when dealing with piecewise functions. For example, analyze the limit at x=2 of the function that gives (x-2)² for values lower than 2 and 2-x² for values lager than 2.

name: Limits at infinity (Hindi) (Limits (Hindi) )
blurb: Find limits of functions at infinity.

name: Copy of Formal definition of limits (optional) (Hindi) (Limits (Hindi) )
blurb: The epsilon-delta definition of a limit is not assessed on the AP Calculus AB or BC Exam. However, teachers may include this topic in the course if time permits.

name: Review: Limits from equations (Hindi) (Limits (Hindi) )
blurb: Review your limit-evaluation skills with some challenge problems.

name: Introduction to differential calculus (Hindi) (Derivatives (Hindi))
blurb: What's differential calculus all about? An answer to this question lies just right here.

name: Derivative as slope of tangent line (Hindi) (Derivatives (Hindi))
blurb: One way of thinking about the derivative (of a function at a point) is as the slope of the tangent line (to the function's graph at that point). Get comfortable with this approach here.

name: Derivative as instantaneous rate of change (Hindi) (Derivatives (Hindi))
blurb: One way of thinking about the derivative is as instantaneous rate of change. This is quite incredible because rate of change is usually found over a period of time, and not at an instant. Get comfortable with this approach here.

name: Secant lines (Hindi) (Derivatives (Hindi))
blurb: Gain some experience working with secant lines. This will help us on our journey to find a formal definition for the derivative.

name: Derivative as a limit (Hindi) (Derivatives (Hindi))
blurb: The derivative is actually a special kind of limit! This is yet another important stop on our continuing journey towards a formal definition of the derivative.

name: Formal definition of derivative (Hindi) (Derivatives (Hindi))
blurb: There are two ways to define the derivative of function f at point x=a. The formal definition is the limit of [f(a+h)-f(x)]/h as h approaches 0, and the alternative definition is the limit of [f(x)-f(a)]/(x-a) as x approaches a. Make introduction with these two definitions.

name: Using the formal definition of derivative (Hindi) (Derivatives (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how we can use their formal definition in order to find the derivatives of specific functions. For example, we find the derivative of f(x)=x² at x=3, or for any x-value.

name: Derivative as a function (Hindi) (Derivatives (Hindi))
blurb: This may blow your mind, but the derivative of a function is a function in itself! Get comfortable in thinking about the derivative as a function that is separate from, but tightly related to, its original function.

name: Review: Derivative basics (Hindi) (Derivatives (Hindi))
blurb: Review your conceptual understanding of derivatives with some challenge problems.

name: Basic differentiation rules (Hindi) (Differentiation (Hindi))
blurb: If you ever tried to find derivatives using their formal definition, you probably know how tedious that may be. Fortunately, we have ways for finding derivatives much quicker, using differentiation rules! Make your first steps in this fascinating world by working with the more basic rules. For example, the derivative of [f(x)+g(x)] is f'(x)+g'(x), and the derivative of k⋅f(x) is k⋅f'(x).

name: Power rule (Hindi) (Differentiation (Hindi))
blurb: The power rule says that the derivative of xⁿ is n⋅xⁿ⁻¹. It allows us to quickly find the derivative of any polynomial, and it doesn't even stop there! Make introduction with this simple but powerful rule.

name: Polynomial functions differentiation (Hindi) (Differentiation (Hindi))
blurb: Put the power rule to use by differentiating various polynomials.

name: Rational functions differentiation (intro) (Hindi) (Differentiation (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how the power rule can be used to differentiate some basic rational functions.

name: Radical functions differentiation (intro) (Hindi) (Differentiation (Hindi))
blurb: Learn how the power rule can be used to differentiate some basic radical functions.

name: Sine & cosine, eˣ and ln(x) derivatives (Hindi) (Differentiation (Hindi))
blurb: The derivative of sin(x) is cos(x) and the derivative of cos(x) is -sin(x). How convenient! Practice differentiating functions that include sine and cosine.

name: Review: Basic differentiation (Hindi) (Differentiation (Hindi))
blurb: Review your understanding of basic differentiation rules and your knowledge of the derivatives of common functions with some challenge problems.

name: Product rule (Hindi) (Differentiation (Hindi))
blurb: The product rule says that the derivative of the product f(x)g(x) is f'(x)g(x)+f(x)g'(x). This helps us find the derivative of a function which is a product of two other, more basic, functions.

blurb: Learn to count from 0 to 20.

name: Numbers 0 to 120 (Counting)
blurb: Learn the numbers from 0 to 120.

blurb: Learn to count up to 20 objects.

blurb: Learn to compare numbers between 0 and 10.

blurb: Learn what it means to add. Learn what it means to subtract.

name: Making small numbers (Addition and subtraction intro)
blurb: Learn to make numbers from other numbers by adding. Numbers used are 10 or less.

name: Making 10 (Addition and subtraction intro)
blurb: Learn how to make the number 10 from two smaller numbers.

name: Put together, take apart (Addition and subtraction intro)
blurb: When we add, we put together. When we subtract, we take apart. Numbers used are 10 or less.

name: Relate addition and subtraction (Addition and subtraction intro)
blurb: Learn how to addition and subtraction are related. Numbers used are 10 or less.

name: Addition and subtraction word problems (Addition and subtraction intro)
blurb: Learn how to solve addition and subtraction word problems with small numbers. Numbers used are 10 or less.

name: Teens (Place value (tens and hundreds))

blurb: Learn to see two-digit numbers as tens and ones.

name: Missing number within 20 (Addition and subtraction within 20)
blurb: Learn how to solve problems like "___ + 7 = 18" where you don't know one of the values in an addition or subtraction equation.

name: Word problems within 20 (Addition and subtraction within 20)
blurb: Learn how to solve addition and subtraction word problems. Numbers used are 20 or less.

name: Word problems with "more" and "fewer" (Addition and subtraction within 20)
blurb: Learn how to solve word problems that use the words "more" and "fewer". Numbers used are 20 or less.

name: Repeated addition (Addition and subtraction within 20)
blurb: Adding the same number to itself over and over

blurb: Learn how to solve addition problems like 23+4 and 23+40.

name: Subtracting ones and tens (Addition and subtraction within 100)

name: Intro to addition with two-digit numbers (Addition and subtraction within 100)
blurb: Learn how to add two-digit numbers. By the end of this tutorial, you'll be able to solve problems like 48+6 and 48+21. More advanced problems like 48+28 will be covered in a future tutorial.

name: Intro to subtraction with two-digit numbers (Addition and subtraction within 100)

blurb: Learn to add two-digit numbers like 37 and 49.

name: Subtraction within 100 (Addition and subtraction within 100)
blurb: Learn to subtract two-digit numbers like 47 and 39.

name: Word problems within 100 (Addition and subtraction within 100)
blurb: Learn how to solve addition and subtraction word problems. Numbers used 100 or less.

name: Word problems with "more" and "fewer" (within 100) (Addition and subtraction within 100)

name: Subtracting and ones, tens, and hundreds (Addition and subtraction within 1000)

blurb: Take an understanding of basic multiplication and division a little further to solve for unknowns in multiplication and division problems.

name: Properties of multiplication (Multiplication and division)
blurb: Learn about the commutative, associative, and distributive properties of multiplication.  Solve multiplication problems by changing the order of factors (commutativity), the grouping of factors (associativity), and by decomposing the factors (distributive property).

name: Multi-step word problems (Multiplication and division)
blurb:
We are now going to solve real-world problems using multiple steps.  Along the way, we'll be using letters to represent unknown quantities.

Common Core Standard: 3.OA.D.8

name: Multiplying by 10 (Multiplication and division)
blurb:
As we'll see in this tutorial, multiplying a multiple of 10--like 10, 20, 30, 40, etc.--by a single digit number is not too much more complicated.

Common Core Standard: 3.NBT.A.3

name: Patterns in arithmetic (Multiplication and division)
blurb:
Math is full of patterns that will keep emerging as you explore it (this is what makes math so beautiful).  We begin to just scratch the surface in this tutorial!

Common Core Standards: 3.OA.B.5, 3.OA.D.9

name: Fractions intro (Fractions)
blurb: Learn what a fraction is and identify unit fractions.

name: What fractions mean (Fractions)
blurb: Learn to recognize fractions and their parts.

name: Fractions on the number line (Fractions)
blurb: Learn to identify fractions on a number line.

name: Fractions and whole numbers (Fractions)
blurb: Learn how to represent fractions as whole numbers and whole numbers as fractions.

name: Equivalent fractions (Fractions)
blurb: Learn how to create equivalent fractions using visuals.

name: Equivalent fractions on the number line (Fractions)
blurb: Learn how to identify fractions on a number line.

name: Comparing fractions (Fractions)
blurb: Learn to compare fractions with the same numerator or same denominator.

name: Comparing fractions of different wholes (Fractions)
blurb: Learn about comparing fractions that represent different wholes.

name: Telling time (Measurement and geometry)
blurb: Solve word problems involving time.  Use number lines, digital clocks, and analog clocks.

name: Mass (Measurement and geometry)
blurb: Estimate the mass of items.  Solve word problems involving mass.

name: Volume (Measurement and geometry)
blurb: Estimate the volume of items.  Solve word problems involving volume.

name: Data (Measurement and geometry)
blurb: Read and interpret bar graphs.  Also, make some graphs of your own!

name: Picture graphs (Measurement and geometry)
blurb: Read and interpret picture graphs.  Also, make some graphs of your own!

name: Line plots (Measurement and geometry)
blurb: Read and interpret line plots.  Also, make some graphs of your own!

name: Area (Geometry)
blurb: Area is how we think about how much space something takes in two dimensions, such as comparing how much land one property takes up versus another. In this tutorial, we'll take a look at how area is measured.

name: Count unit squares to find area (Geometry)
blurb: Find area of shapes by counting unit squares.  Some shapes will require combining partial square units to find area.  Create rectangles with a given area by covering unit squares.

name: Area formula intuition (Geometry)
blurb: Transition from counting unit squares to multiplying side length to find area.  Measure side lengths with a ruler to find area.

name: Multiply to find area (Geometry)
blurb: Find area of rectangles by multiplying side lengths.  Find a missing side length of a rectangle when given the other side length and area.  Compare areas of rectangles presented in images or contexts.

name: Area and the distributive property (Geometry)
blurb: Use the distributive property to find area of rectangles.

name: Decompose figures to find area (Geometry)
blurb: Decompose figures into two to three rectangles to find area of entire figure.

name: Perimeter (Geometry)
blurb: Have you ever wondered how much fencing you need to surround a plot of land? No? Well, you should still go through this tutorial just in case. You'll learn what perimeter is and how to calculate it.

name: Comparing area and perimeter (Geometry)
blurb: Compare the areas and perimeters of rectangles when given a context or picture.

name: Perimeter word problems (Geometry)
blurb: Solve real world problems problems involving perimeter.

name: Shapes (Geometry)
blurb: Classify quadrilaterals, including rectangles, rhombuses, and squares.  See what attributes they have in common and which ones make them unique.

name: Rounding (Place value and rounding)
blurb: Rounding is useful when you are trying to roughly estimate numbers.

name: Adding multi-digit numbers (Addition and subtraction)
blurb: Learn to add large numbers with ease!

name: Subtracting multi-digit numbers (Addition and subtraction)
blurb: In the 3rd grade, you learned to subtract multi-digit numbers.  This includes subtraction through regrouping (sometimes known as "borrowing").  This tutorial will give you practice doing this with even larger numbers.  Have fun!  Common Core Standard: 4.NBT.B.4

name: Multiplication by tens, hundreds, and thousands (Multiplication and division)
blurb: Learn to multiply whole numbers by multiples of ten. Example: 7 x 500 = 3500

name: Multiplication: place value and area models (Multiplication and division)
blurb: Most people learn to multiply, but only a select-few actually understand what the multiplication represents. This tutorial, with the help of grids and area models, will allow you to be part of this elite group.

name: Multi-digit multiplication (Multiplication and division)
blurb: You know your multiplication tables (and basic division) from the 3rd grade and are ready to learn how to multiply and divide multi-digit numbers.  Imagine the possibilities!  This tutorial will make you unstoppable.

name: Comparing with multiplication (Multiplication and division)
blurb: In this tutorial, we look at multiplication and division through the lens of comparison.  For example, say that you are 9 and 3 times older than your cousin.  How old would your cousin be? Multiplying a number times 3 gets you to your age, 9. Can you figure out the answer? We'll go through several exercises together so you get enough practice to feel confident multiplying. By the way, memorizing your multiplication tables helps a lot!

name: Division problems that work out nicely (Multiplication and division)
blurb: Learn to solve division problems like 3500 ÷ 50 that work out nicely.

name: Division: place value and area (Multiplication and division)
blurb: Dividing big numbers can be difficult to wrap your mind around. In this tutorial, we'll learn some visual ways to think through large division problems.

name: Multi-digit division (Multiplication and division)
blurb: You know your multiplication tables and are getting the hang of basic division. In this tutorial, we will journey into the world of loooong division (sometimes, referred to as "long division", but that's not as much fun to say). After this tutorial, you'll be able to divide any whole number by a single digit number.

name: Remainders (Multiplication and division)
blurb: Some division problems don't work out perfectly. For example, we know that 6 divided by 3 is 2, and 9 divided by 3 is 3. But, what is 7 divided by 3? Or 8 divided by 3? In division problems like these, we're left with remainders.

name: Multistep word problems (Multiplication and division)
blurb: In this tutorial, we'll start to challenge you with more sophisticated multiplication and division word problems. If you understand mult-digit multiplication and long division, you have all the tools you need to tackle these. May the force be with you!  Common Core Standard: 4.OA.A.3

name: Visualizing equivalent fractions (Fractions)
blurb: Learn how to find equivalent fractions by multiplying the numerator and denominator by the same number.

name: Common denominators (Fractions)
blurb: Using our knowledge of equivalent fractions, let's rewrite fractions to have the same denominator.

name: Comparing fractions with unlike denominators (Fractions)
blurb: Learn how to compare fractions with unlike denominators by drawing diagrams to represent each fraction.

name: Comparing fractions (Fractions)
blurb: Learn how to compare fractions with unlike denominators. Along the way, practice finding common denominators and simplifying fractions.

name: Decomposing fractions (Fractions)
blurb: See that a fraction can be broken up (or decomposed) into a bunch of other fractions.

name: Adding and subtracting fractions with like denominators (Fractions)
blurb: Learn how to add and subtract fractions. This is an introductory tutorial, so the fractions you add and subtract have the same denominators.

name: Adding and subtracting fractions: word problems (Fractions)
blurb: Learn how to solve word problems by adding and subtracting fractions. This is an introductory tutorial, so the fractions you add and subtract have the same denominators.

name: Mixed numbers (Fractions)
blurb: Learn how to write improper fractions as mixed numbers (and mixed numbers as improper fractions).

name: Adding and subtracting mixed numbers (Fractions)
blurb: Learn how to add and subtract mixed numbers. This is an introductory tutorial, so the fractions you add and subtract have the same denominators.

name: Multiplying unit fractions and whole numbers (Fractions)
blurb: Learn how to multiply unit fractions and whole numbers.

name: Multiplying whole numbers and fractions (Fractions)
blurb: Learn the art of multiplying whole numbers by fractions. See how 3 times 2/3 is the same as 6 times 1/3, which is the same as 6/3.

name: Multiplying whole numbers and fractions word problems (Fractions)
blurb: Learn how to solve word problems by multiplying whole numbers and fractions.

name: Adding fractions with denominators of 10 and 100 (Fractions)
blurb: Practice working with fractions that have denominators of 10 and 100. This practice prepares us for the next tutorial on decimal numbers.

name: Introduction to decimals (Decimals)
blurb: What are decimal numbers? How are they like fractions?

name: Decimals on the number line (Decimals)
blurb: See how decimals can be placed on the number line, just like fractions and whole numbers can.

name: Decimals vs. fractions (Decimals)
blurb: See how decimals and fractions are just two ways to write the same number.

name: Decimals greater than one (Decimals)
blurb: In this tutorial, we use tenths and hundredths to describe numbers greater than 1.

name: Converting decimals to fractions (Decimals)
blurb: Learn how to rewrite decimals as fractions.

name: Common fractions and decimals (Decimals)
blurb: Learn about common fractions and their decimal forms like 1 /2 = 0.5, 3/4 = 0.75, and 2/5 = 0.4.

name: Comparing decimals visually (Decimals)
blurb: Learn how to compare decimals by drawing diagrams to represent each number.

name: Comparing decimals (Decimals)
blurb: Learn how to compare decimal numbers. Decimals in this tutorial are limited to tenths and hundredths.

name: Metric and U.S. customary volume intro (Measurement and data)
blurb: An introduction to units for measuring mass. The metric units used in this tutorial are grams and kilograms.  The US customary units in this tutorial are ounces and pounds.

name: Metric and U.S. customary volume intro (Measurement and data)
blurb: An introduction to units for measuring volume. The metric units used in this tutorial are milliliters and liters.  The US customary units in this tutorial are cups, pints, quarts, and gallons.

name: Metric and U.S. customary length intro (Measurement and data)
blurb: An introduction to units for measuring length. The metric units used in this tutorial are millimeters, centimeters, meters, and kilometers  The US customary units in this tutorial are inches, feet, yards, and miles.

name: Estimating time (Measurement and data)
blurb: An introduction to units for measuring time. The units used in this tutorial are seconds, minutes, and hours.

name: Converting units of mass (Measurement and data)
blurb: Learn how convert larger units of mass to smaller units.  The metric units used in this tutorial are grams and kilograms.  The US customary units in this tutorial are ounces and pounds.

name: Converting units of volume (Measurement and data)
blurb: Learn how convert larger units of volume to smaller units.  The metric units used in this tutorial are milliliters and liters.  The US customary units in this tutorial are cups, pints, quarts, and gallons.

name: Converting units of length (Measurement and data)
blurb: Learn how convert larger units of length to smaller units.  The metric units used in this tutorial are millimeters, centimeters, meters, and kilometers  The US customary units in this tutorial are inches, feet, yards, and miles.

name: Converting units of time (Measurement and data)
blurb: Learn how convert larger units of time to smaller units.  The units used in this tutorial are seconds, minutes, and hours.

name: Money word problems (Measurement and data)
blurb: Learn how to solve a variety of problems involving money.

name: Conversion word problems (Measurement and data)
blurb: Use the four operations to solve word problems involving distances, liquid volumes, masses of objects.  Practice includes both metric and US customary units of measure.

name: Area and perimeter (Measurement and data)
blurb: Rectangles are common shapes that you will often find the need to compare. Who has a bigger poster size? Whose yard has more grass to mow? We'll learn about length, width, area, and perimeter--about all you need to know to begin comparing!

name: Data (Measurement and data)
blurb: Learn how to create and read line plots that use fractions.

name: Lines, line segments and rays (Geometry)
blurb: Let's draw points, lines, line segments, and rays.  We'll also think about perpendicular and parallel lines and identify these in two-dimensional figures.  Common Core Standard: 4.G.A.1

name: Parallel and perpendicular (Geometry)
blurb: Learn the definitions of "parallel" and "perpendicular".

name: Angle introduction (Geometry)
blurb: What is an angle and how do we label, measure and construct them? Great question. Luckily we have all your answers! To begin our journey towards understanding angles, we'll learn terms like vertex, acute, obtuse, circle arc, circumference, and protractor. These basic angle concepts will get you on the road to angle domination!

name: Measuring angles (Geometry)
blurb: Learn how to measure angles using a protractor.

name: Constructing angles (Geometry)
blurb: Learn how to draw angles using a protractor.

name: Angles in circles (Geometry)
blurb: Learn how to measure angles using a circle protractor and solve word problems about angles as part of a circle.

name: Angle types (Geometry)
blurb: Now that we know what angles are, let's dig a bit deeper and classify them and understand their properties better. Acute, obtuse, right, adjacent--all are angles that we will be become familiar with.

name: Decomposing angles (Geometry)
blurb: Learn to combine angles and take them apart to create new angles.

name: Line of symmetry (Geometry)
blurb: A line of symmetry for a two-dimensional figure is a line across the figure such that the figure can be folded along the line into matching parts. In this tutorial, we'll identify line-symmetric figures and draw lines of symmetry.  Common Core Standard: 4.G.A.3

name: Classifying triangles (Geometry)
blurb: Triangles can be classified in different ways. In this tutorial, we'll learn about scalene, isosceles, equilateral, acute, right, and obtuse triangles.

name: Classifying shapes (Geometry)
blurb: Some practice classifying geometric shapes.

name: Factors and multiples (Factors, multiples and patterns)
blurb: In this tutorial, we'll begin to think about the numbers that "make up" the number. This will be useful throughout our study of math. Whether we are adding fractions, exploring mystical number patterns, or breaking computer codes, factoring numbers are key! Let's go, kids!  Common Core Standard: 4.OA.B.4

name: Prime and composite numbers (Factors, multiples and patterns)
blurb: Prime numbers have been studied by mathematicians and mystics for ages (seriously). They are both basic and mysterious. The more you explore them, the more you will realize that the universe is a fascinating place. This tutorial will introduce you to the magical world of prime numbers as well as their composite number brethren.  Common Core Standard: 4.OA.B.4

name: Math patterns (Factors, multiples and patterns)
blurb: Let's now use our mathematical toolkit to discover and make use of patterns!  This is a seriously fun tutorial.

name: Place value introduction (Place value and rounding)
blurb: Learn about whole number place values, create numbers with given place values, and use place value blocks to identify a number.

name: How 10 relates to place value (Place value and rounding)
blurb: Learn to multiply and divide whole numbers by 10.  Learn how multiplying and dividing by 10 affects place value.

name: Ways to write numbers (standard, written, and expanded forms) (Place value and rounding)
blurb: Learn to write whole numbers in expanded form, written form, and standard form.

name: Regrouping whole numbers (Place value and rounding)
blurb: Regroup whole numbers based on their place values.

name: Comparing multi-digit numbers (Place value and rounding)
blurb: Compare whole numbers with at least 3 digits.

name: Rounding whole numbers (Place value and rounding)
blurb: If you're looking to create an army of robot dogs, will it really make a difference if you have 10,300 dogs, 9,997 dogs or 10,005 dogs? Probably not. All you really care about is how many dogs you have to, say, the nearest thousand (10,000 dogs). In this tutorial, you'll learn about conventions for rounding whole numbers. Very useful when you might not need to (or cannot) be completely precise.  Common Core Standard: 4.NBT.A.3

name: Common fractions and decimals (Addition and subtraction)
blurb: Learn about common fractions and their decimal forms like 1 /2 = 0.5, 3/4 = 0.75, and 2/5 = 0.4.

name: Adding decimals intro (Addition and subtraction)
blurb: Add decimals using estimation and visual models.  Then, use different strategies to add decimals to the tenths place.

name: Adding decimals (Addition and subtraction)
blurb: You get the general idea of decimals and what the digits in different places represent (place value). Now you're ready to do something with the decimals. Adding and subtracting is a good place to start. This will allow you to add your family's expenses to figure out if your little brother is laundering money (perhaps literally). Have fun!  Common Core Standard: 5.NBT.B.7

name: Subtracting decimals intro  (Addition and subtraction)
blurb: Subtract decimals using estimation and visual models.  Then, use different strategies to subtract decimals to the tenths place.

name: Subtracting decimals (Addition and subtraction)
blurb: Anything you can do with whole numbers, you can do with decimals.  Subtraction is no exception.  In this tutorial, you'll get some good practice subtracting decimals up the hundredths place.

name: Multi-digit multiplication (Multiplication and division)
blurb: Learn how to multiply multi-digit whole numbers like 345 times 892.

name: Multiplying decimals (Multiplication and division)
blurb: The real world is seldom about whole numbers. If you precisely measure anything, you're likely to get a decimal. If you don't know how to multiply these decimals, then you won't be able to do all the powerful things that multiplication can do in the real world (figure out your commission as a robot possum salesperson, determining how much shag carpet you need for your secret lair, etc.).

name: Multi-digit division (Multiplication and division)
blurb: We're taking division a step further and moving beyond single-number division. Let's learn to divide any whole number by a multiple-digit whole number!   Common Core Standard: 5.NBT.B.6

name: Dividing decimals (Multiplication and division)
blurb: In this tutorial, we'll extend our division skills to include decimals! We get into some pretty fun stuff here including dividing decimals by whole numbers, and dividing whole numbers by decimals. Finally...dividing decimals by decimals.  Common Core Standard 5.NBT.B.7

name: Visually adding and subtracting fractions with unlike denominators (Fractions)
blurb: An introduction to adding and subtracting fractions with unlike denominators that uses visual fraction models

name: Common denominators (Fractions)
blurb: Using our knowledge of equivalent fractions, let's rewrite fractions to have the same denominator.

name: Adding and subtracting fractions with unlike denominators (Fractions)
blurb: Learn how to add and subtract fractions that have different denominators.

name: Adding and subtracting mixed number with unlike denominators (Fractions)
blurb: Learn how to add and subtract mixed numbers whose fractional parts have different denominators.

name: Adding and subtracting fractions with unlike denominators word problems (Fractions)
blurb: Practice solving word problems by adding and subtracting fractions that have different denominators.

name: Multiplication as scaling (Fractions)
blurb: Learn to see multiplication as a way to grow (scale up) and shrink (scale down) other numbers.

name: Multiplying fractions and whole numbers (Fractions)
blurb: Learn how to multiply a fraction by a whole number.

name: Multiplying fractions and whole numbers word problems (Fractions)
blurb: Get some practice solving word problems by multiplying fractions by whole numbers.

name: Multiplying fractions (Fractions)
blurb: Learn how to multiply a fraction by a fraction.

name: Multiplying mixed numbers (Fractions)
blurb: Learn how to multiply mixed numbers.

name: Multiplying fractions word problems (Fractions)
blurb: Get some practice solving word problems by multiplying fractions.

name: Fractions as division (Fractions)
blurb: **Spoiler Alert!** The fraction bar and the division symbol are really saying the same thing.

name: Dividing unit fractions by whole numbers (Fractions)
blurb: Learn how to divide unit fractions by whole numbers. Example: 1/5 ÷ 3 = 1/15.

name: Dividing whole numbers by unit fractions (Fractions)
blurb: Learn how to divide whole numbers by unit fractions. Example: 4 ÷ 1/3 = 12.

name: Dividing fractions and whole numbers word problems (Fractions)
blurb: Learn how to solve word problems by dividing fractions and whole numbers.

name: Decimal place value introduction (Place value and decimals)
blurb: Learn the basics of decimal place value.

name: Expanded form for decimals (Place value and decimals)
blurb: Learn how to write a decimal like 3.14 in expanded form (3 + 0.1 + 0.04).

name: Decimals in written form (Place value and decimals)
blurb: Learn how to write decimals like 3.14 in words as "three and fourteen hundredths".

name: Comparing decimals (Place value and decimals)
blurb: Learn to tell which of two decimal numbers is bigger by thinking about place value.

name: Rounding decimals (Place value and decimals)
blurb: Learn how to round decimal numbers to specific place values. For example, round 3.14159 to the nearest hundredth as 3.14.

name: Multiplying and dividing whole numbers by 10, 100, and 1000 (Place value and decimals)
blurb: Learn how to, for example, multiply 560 by 100 to get 56,000.

name: Multiplying and dividing decimals by 10, 100, and 1000 (Place value and decimals)
blurb: Learn how to, for example, multiply 34.5 by 100 to get 3450.

name: Powers of 10 (Place value and decimals)
blurb: Learn how exponents are a simpler way to write something like 10x10x10.

name: Multiplying and dividing with powers of 10 (Place value and decimals)
blurb: Learn how to shift the decimal point when you multiply and divide by powers of ten.

name: Comparing decimal place values (Place value and decimals)
blurb: For a number like 34.135, learn how to compare the 3 in the tens place to the 3 in the hundredths place.

name: Regrouping decimal numbers (Place value and decimals)
blurb: Let's tackle some more challenging problems that stretch our understanding of decimal place value. These problems involve regrouping place values in interesting ways.

name: Volume intro (Measurement and data)
blurb: Welcome to the 3rd dimension! [cue spooky music] This tutorial explains how to find volume.

name: Volume (Measurement and data)
blurb: This tutorial has us calculate the volume of rectangular prisms.

name: Unit conversion (Measurement and data)
blurb: Wait, I'm in Europe and my car only tells my distance traveled in kilometers! But I'm used to a units of distance devised by the Romans to measure the average length of 1000 paces of a soldier (the "mile")! How do I operate? This tutorial is about the fundamental skill of unit conversion. Sal's cousin Nadia being a bit confused with this was actually the reason why he started tutoring her (which led to the creation of the Khan Academy).  Common Core Standard: 5.MD.A.1
